conclusion: To solve the problem, analyze the x-t graph to determine the car's position at the end of the 2nd second and calculate speed using speed = distance/time.
The image shows a graph of position (x) versus time (t) with a slope of 10 m/s, indicating constant velocity. The vertical line at t = 2 seconds intersects the graph at x = 20 meters.
Identify the position of the car at t = 2 seconds from the graph as x = 20 meters.
Calculate the distance traveled by the car from t = 0 to t = 2 seconds as 20 meters.
Use the formula for speed: speed = distance/time with distance as 20 meters and time as 2 seconds.
Substitute values into the formula: speed = 20 meters / 2 seconds = 10 meters per second.
The car's speed at the end of the 2nd second is 10 meters per second.
